title: merge_stats_tables
description: Merges a set of stats table files into a single stats table where each line is a subject and each column is a segmentation or parcellation.

subjectsfile.title: Subjects File
subjectsfile.description: Name of the file which has the list of subjects (one subject per line)

inputs.title: Input Files
inputs.description: Specify all the input stat files

input.title: Input File
input.description: Specify a single input stat file

meas.title: Measure
meas.description: Measure to write in output table

common_segs.title: Common Segments
common_segs.description: Output only the common segmentations of all the statsfiles given

all_segs.title: All Segments
all_segs.description: Output all the segmentations of the statsfiles given

intable.title: Input Table
intable.description: Use `fname` as input (REQUIRED when passing subject ids)

subdir.title: Subdirectory
subdir.description: Use `subdir` instead of default "stats/" when passing subject ids

delimiter.title: Delimiter
delimiter.description: Delimiter between measures in the table. Options are 'tab', 'space', 'comma', and 'semicolon'. Default is 'space'.

transpose.title: Transpose Table
transpose.description: Transpose the table (default is subjects in rows and segmentations in cols)

skip.title: Skip Missing Files
skip.description: If a subject does not have a stats file, skip it instead of exiting.
